@alfatrack2 Hi - there's a couple of reasons - firstly the air is less humid, therefore there are less particles in the air to block the sun's rays (sunsets will also look crisper in less polluted areas), and they also take longer to set, closer to the winter solstice. ^Katie

Clear skies in the north will lead to some fog and also a touch of frost in the sheltered glens of Scotland tonight

Much milder further south as cloud and rain pushes in https://t.co/amazIUJqyH
